But come on y'all Obama is about the FUTURE, man. Don't you care about the FUTURE? I mean, we need a change. Change for the future! We need to work TOGETHER for the FUTURE so we can CHANGE. I mean, the past is over and you can't CHANGE the past! But we've got to look forward! Forward to the future!

Obama is a fresh face and very appealing......but does he have what it takes when the next big foreign policy crisis hits?
 
 Obama's remarks that he would sit down without any pre-conditions to meet with the likes of Iran's president and the North Korean tyrant is very naive.
 Of course now he has chaned his tune a bit and talks about "processes" before any meeting but it illustrates his lack of experience in foreign policy.
 
 As for the economy....change is needed but what kind of changes? It needs to be the right kind of changes, change for the sake of change will not fix any problems. Besides Obama has not said how he will pay for these changes when there is a big deficit.
 
 Obama will be ready 8 years down the road but not now.
Penfold
He can likely read a teleprompter as well as Reagan ever did, and certainly better than Dubya.

I don't see any other choice than to support Obama in this election. He wants to TALK with our enemies. How can anything get done if we don't TALK?
 And he wants to bomb the tribal areas in Pakistan to get rid of the Taliban. How can we accomplish anything without bombing?
 And he cares about the FUTURE. If you don't care about the future, how can anything change? And we NEED change. This country is HORRIBLE. I mean, think about it (and don't try to make excuses because we've only been around for 230 years) this country doesn't help the world at all. And nothing important is invented here because our higher education system is not completely cost free. We need to change! Our people are not free. We need change! Some people actually believe that we outta require people to attempt to support themselves, rather than making them wards of the state. We need to change! The top 10% of households only pay 70% of income taxes while the bottom 50% have to pay 3%. This is an outrage! The top 10% should pay it all! Why, they barely create enough jobs as it is. Look how HORRIBLE unemployment is, around 5%. We need change!
 
 With Obama as President, he'll care about the future. And we know this is true because he TALKS about it! So things will CHANGE! God Bless Obama! emoticon_xlove

Yes, we need change but that is just empty words until Obama spells out and gives details of the changes he has in mind. ...
 
 Change? Nobody seems to know what kind of change obama has in mind.

 
 Nobody? Really? How about anyone who bothers to go to his website? 
 
 Here, let me spoonfeed you: 
 
 BLUEPRINT FOR CHANGE: http://www.barackobama.com/pdf/ObamaBlueprintForChange.pdf

 One that I particularly care about is Ethics. Here's the page: http://www.barackobama.com/issues/ethics/

 Here's the text and video of a speech he delivered on this subject last summer: http://www.barackobama.com/2007/06/22/remarks_of_senator_barack_obam_17.php
 
 For more of his views, there's the People section. Latinos, for instance: http://my.barackobama.com/page/content/latinoshome/
 
 Where Obama stands on Latino issues: http://my.barackobama.com/page/content/latinosissues
 
 An Op-ed he wrote recently: "I will repair our relationship with Mexico" http://my.barackobama.com/page/community/post/jennyu/gGCPkg

JL...W

BTW, I cannot find Kirk Watson (D-Texas) in our Library of Congress. Can anyone else? 
 
 Does this absence of information on Mr. Watson's record ... have anything to do with Mr. Watson's absence of knowledge re Mr. Obama's record? ... absence of understanding ... as to why they're there ...?*
 
 Or does he go by another name in Washington?
 
 
 * And while we pay Mr. Watson's salary, health and retirement benefits, even after temporary employment.

 
 You didn't think to Google??
 
 Unless you live in Texas where he is a state senator, and former mayor of Austin, you're not paying his salary or benefits. 
 
 Here's his website response to his Hardball appearance: 
 
 http://www.kirkwatson.com/media/whats-new/2008/02/20/msnbc-and-me/
antonia

You didn't think to Google??
 
 Unless you live in Texas where he is a state senator, and former mayor of Austin, you're not paying his salary or benefits. 
 
 Here's his website response to his Hardball appearance: 
 
 http://www.kirkwatson.com/media/whats-new/2008/02/20/msnbc-and-me/

 
 I was just kidding. You'll notice I edited my remark.
 
 Gee, you Obamarama fans are so touchy about this incident. emoticon_cry
 
 But I wouldn't give his promotional site if I were that interested in deciminating information in the public's interest, not the politician's. Frankly, I don't think Mr. Watson deserves to be in an elected position, paid for by the American public. 
 
 But maybe you don't think we deserve more from our elected officials!
 
 And maybe Mr. Obama doesn't either!
antonia

I'm just an American voter, not an elected official. If I were on Hardball, or in a focus group for Hannity, even without supporting any candidate, I could tell you more than one legislative accomplishment for Mrs. Clinton, for Mr. McCain, for Mr. Obama, and for Congress, in the past 7 years. I also know something about Mrs. Jones' record.
 
 What a sorry state Watson reflects on the disinformative affairs of politics, campaigns, behind the door deals, and voting.
 
 It's a disgrace. And what's even more a disgrace is that Obama fans defend it.
 
 Also. What Chris Matthews couldn't say, as a journalist on television. (But I will on the internet, and, what so many viewers thought at that moment.) Congress' big accomplishment in the past seven years. Keeping us in Iraq, boys and girls, and keeping on funding it. While the American economy continues to go to hell. While they're being paid for it, health and retirement benefits included, and for temporary employment. While Americans lose their homes, lose their jobs, their medical care, go bankrupt ...
 
 I hope Texans vote more wisely this time around. I have more confidence in Ohio, though. (But hey, they did give us Ann Richards and Barbara Jordon.)
 
 So I have absolutely no sympathy for paid derrieres like Watson, Democrat or Republican, who fooled a lot of Texans when they ran for office. And when there so many better qualified persons who could serve.
 
 Heck, I'd take any of those young people on youtube (linked earlier) any day. I'd proactively support their candidacy. How unfortunate for these fine young people, who are really inheriting the mess, that representatives or "grown-ups" like Watson don't even care what legislative accomplishments their endorsees have. Just what commercial image inspires, and ... keeps them in office. Playing the game well, but otherwise, doing nothing, when they aren't destroying the country.
 
 So I want a candidate with a time-tested track record. Who's pragmatic and predictable. Has proven accountability. I don't feel like gambling with my country's future.
 
 I have all the inspiration I need from within.
 
 Oh, and I'll hold on to my cynicism, thank you. Under the First Amendment. No American president shall make any demands on me in that sense.

You say this today, after listening to the rhetoric they both have written for them by expert handlers. 
 
 Just wait until she has been in office for a few months. You'll be asking for her head on a platter.
 
 The woman is dreadfully dangerous to our existence as a free nation of relatively happy people.
 
 We have enjoyed the pursuit of life, liberty and happiness. She will tone down our life style and introduce us to the realities of socialism and collectivism. You will see her mutate from a smiling promoter of more entitlements for the people to a dictator of what she thinks the people need.
 
 I heard in her speech the other day how she thinks the people are asking when the government is going to do such and such for them, as opposed to that opposite tact of Kennedy's asking people to do for the country rather than find ways to take from it.
 
 
 Hillary is a dangerous fox. God help us all!
